name: Charles Grimm
statement:
**Elected Experience**  
Precinct Committee Officer 2020-2024, Republican State Committeeman 2020-2022   
  
**Other Professional Experience**  
I have owned my own business in Franklin County for 16 years; 11 in North Franklin County, and almost 5 years in Pasco and currently employ 20 +/- people while managing a multi-million dollar yearly budget.  
  
**Education**  
No information submitted  
  
**Community Service**  
I was on a Planning Commission for a decade where I was the Chair for the majority of that time so I understand working on a municipal Comprehensive Plan and advising the City Council on ordinances. Pasco Chamber Board Member, Franklin Co. Sheriff's Citizen Advisory Board, Volunteer Chaplain at the Union Gospel Mission.   
  
**Statement**  
_We need leadership in Pasco_. I believe in servant-style leadership that listens to the people I serve and asks tough questions on their behalf. I am a constitutional conservative that believes in limited government and fiscal responsibility. I have been married for 17 years and have 5 children. I believe family is the bedrock of civilization and I am a staunch supporter of parental rights. 

_I want to work with Downtown businesses to revitalize the area_ and ensure the commercial/industrial area stays relevant and represented.

_I want to fix West Pasco traffic_. We have a mess on our hands on the 68 corridor. We need to look at a holistic approach that gets people moving again and not just applying a band-aid here and there.

_I want to develop the Broadmoor area responsibly._ The area is just a little smaller than downtown Seattle with a clean slate and a real opportunity for us to create an appealing urban environment of community and commerce in Pasco.

I am a strong supporter of police and I want to find solutions for homelessness, addiction, and mental illness. 

I am grateful for those supporting me and I would be honored to receive your vote.
